channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Trump's tariff threats have rattled Europe's auto giants — but Ferrari appears remarkably unfazed
item.description: Ferrari is thought to be a special case among Europe's automobile sector even as many car giants come under pressure from the threat of U.S. tariffs.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The causes and costs of India's brain drain
item.description: India's brain drain is not unique to the country. It is a perennial issue in emerging or developing markets, given their growing class of educated and aspirational millennials.

item.title: Lebanon had 'no say in the decision to go to war,' foreign minister says
item.description: Both Israel and Hezbollah have accused each other of breaching the cease-fire agreement less than 48 hours after it was agreed.

item.title: Undersea cable cuts in the Baltic Sea are stoking geopolitical tensions — here's what's going on
item.description: The cutting of two undersea cables prompted warnings of "sabotage" and potential "hybrid" warfare in the West amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

item.title: France's political chaos drives borrowing costs to the same level as Greece's for the first time
item.description: France's brewing political crisis is spilling into financial markets with French borrowing costs hitting the same level as debt-ridden Greece's for the first time.

item.title: These economists say artificial intelligence can narrow U.S. deficits by improving health care
item.description: Economists at the Brookings Institution estimate AI could reduce the U.S. budget deficit some $900 billion by 2044.

item.title: Russia tries to stem panic over the plummeting ruble, as the central bank is forced to intervene
item.description: The ruble weakened to 114 against the greenback earliest this week — hitting its lowest level since March 2022, shortly after Russia invaded Ukraine.

item.title: Avoid these 3 common mistakes when asking for a promotion, says INSEAD negotiation professor
item.description: Appraisal season is approaching. Take a look at these three mistakes to avoid when negotiating for a promotion, according to INSEAD professor Horacio Falcão.

item.title: From AI to young new artists, London wants to attract a new generation of art buyers
item.description: London's art galleries, fairs and auction houses are hoping to attract a new generation of collectors.

item.title: NFL star Rob Gronkowski wanted to 'go big' with his first investment at age 25: Now his Apple stock is worth more than $600,000
item.description: Super Bowl champion Rob Gronkowski says he received a valuable piece of investing advice in his 20s from "the man who built my house."

item.title: Shares of key chip suppliers jump as U.S. reportedly considers toned-down China curbs
item.description: ASML and Tokyo Electron shares rose after a report that the U.S. is considering sanctions on China's chip industry that stop short of earlier proposals.

item.title: Chinese yuan to hit record lows as U.S. tariff threat mounts, investment banks forecast
item.description: Major investment banks and research firms project offshore yuan to weaken to an average 7.51 per dollar through the end of 2025, the weakest level on record.

item.title: Apple, Trump and a booming budget surplus: Ireland has much to mull over as voters head to the polls
item.description: A budget surplus and concerns over U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's upcoming tax policies are some of the economic questions facing Ireland.

item.title: OPEC+ postpones meeting to decide oil production strategy to Dec. 5, sources say
item.description: The OPEC+ oil alliance has postponed a meeting to decide the next steps of its crude production strategy to Dec. 5, two delegate sources told CNBC.

item.title: Shipping giant Maersk unveils latest 'dual-fuel methanol vessel' in decarbonization shift
item.description: Denmark-based logistics giant Maersk unveiled its latest dual-fuel methanol vessel in Singapore, as the shipping industry ramps up decarbonization efforts.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: U.S. inflation edged up but investors have things to be thankful for
item.description: Investors and the U.S. Federal Reserve have plenty to be grateful for this Thanksgiving.

item.title: South Korea unexpectedly reduces benchmark lending rates in first back-to-back cuts since 2009
item.description: This surprised economists polled by Reuters, which expected the BOK to hold rates.

item.title: Bitcoin bounces back above $96,000 as investors eye $100,000 milestone heading into Thanksgiving holiday
item.description: Bitcoin climbed back over $96,000 on Wednesday following a pullback this week from its recent record.

item.title: Fed’s preferred inflation gauge rises to 2.3% annually, meeting expectations
item.description: The personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to show inflation at 2.3% in October.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: U.S. inflation edged up but investors aren’t fazed
item.description: Investors and the U.S. Federal Reserve have plenty to be grateful for this Thanksgiving.

item.title: Pharma giant Sanofi opens $595 million vaccine facility in Singapore to prepare for potential pandemics
item.description: It will contribute about 200 skilled jobs to the city-state, and will be fully operational by mid-2026.

item.title: Oil watchers say inflation risks will stave off Trump's Canada tariff threat
item.description: Higher fuel prices are on the cards if President-elect Donald Trump implements tariffs on Canada, said industry experts.

item.title: EasyJet rakes in record $4.5 billion from fare add-ons as CEO slams 'unfair' penalty over practice
item.description: "It's a highly unfair idea that you should not be able to offer products and services targeted for those people who want to use that," Johan Lundgren told CNBC.

item.title: The shipping industry is wrestling with one of its biggest challenges — seafarer shortages
item.description: The shipping industry is contending with a shortage of seafarers, and it's fueling a troubling mix of fake resumes, accidents at sea, and higher freight rates.

item.title: Just Eat Takeaway to delist from London Stock Exchange in blow to UK market
item.description: Dec. 24 will mark the last date of trading of Just Eat Takeaway's shares on the London Stock Exchange.

item.title: 'The key to becoming rich': How to conquer a money bias that could be holding you back, from a financial psychologist
item.description: To grow your wealth, understand how your mind works, says CFP Brad Klontz, psychologist and author of "Start Thinking Rich."

item.title: 'Moana 2'-led Thanksgiving box office could be best in post-pandemic era
item.description: The trifecta of "Moana 2," "Wicked" and "Gladiator II" could make this year's Thanksgiving box office the best in years.

item.title: Homebuyer demand for mortgages jumps 12% after first interest rate drop in over 2 months
item.description: While the drop in rates wasn't exactly huge, there was a fair amount of pent-up demand among homebuyers.

item.title: France's far right propped up the weak government. It could now bring it crashing down
item.description: France's government is hanging by a thread as the far-right National Rally party threatens to bring down Prime Minister Michel Barnier's administration.

item.title: Reddit targets international users for ad growth, teases bolstered search feature
item.description: Reddit is ramping up efforts to attract more users outside of the U.S., with countries like India and Brazil in focus, a top company executive told CNBC.
